title: Fan stopps spinning when I'm trying to measure voltage.
message:
I have a 820-3476-A with fanspin but the CPU remains cool. When I try to measure ALL_SYS_PWRGD the fan instantly stopps spinning and the multimeter shows 0V.
When I disconnect the power cable and reconnect it, the fan spins again. But when I measure the resistors R8169, R8165 or  R8168 at their pin 1 the fan always stops spinning. But not when I measure R8164, that one shows 3.3V at pin 1.

What could be the reason for the fan stopping when voltages are measured?

title: Fan stopps spinning when I'm trying to measure voltage.
message:
PM_SLP_S3_BUF_L is steady high?
If not, check U8180 voltages.
If yes, check R8167 value (ohm scale).

title: Fan stopps spinning when I'm trying to measure voltage.
message: PM_SLP_S3_BUF_L is constantly 3.35V, all U8180 voltages are 3.35V (except GND of course) and R8167 is exactly 10 K Ohm.

title: Fan stopps spinning when I'm trying to measure voltage.
message:
Post voltage on big coils of the board.

Check U1950 for corrosion.

title: Fan stopps spinning when I'm trying to measure voltage.
message: While waiting for your answer I have removed Q8150, to see if that's what's causing the problem. Then I measured ALL_SYS_PWRGD without Q8150 and the fan still stopped spinning. So I soldered Q8150 back. When I reconnected the board to do further measurements I noticed that the CPU got hot! I connected a display and I have a picture!!

title: Fan stopps spinning when I'm trying to measure voltage.
message: Unfortunately it is only partially fixed. Sometimes it recognizes the internal SSD, sometimes not. I noticed that when the SSD is not recognized, the SSD gets burning hot.

title: Fan stopps spinning when I'm trying to measure voltage.
message: Try known good SSD...

title: Fan stopps spinning when I'm trying to measure voltage.
message: Same problem with a known good SSD. The big Samsung Chip close to the connector of the SSD gets very hot. On the screen there is a questionmark folder. In like 1 of 10 tries the SSD gets recognized and the OS boots, but it operates very slow.

title: Fan stopps spinning when I'm trying to measure voltage.
message:
Turn on "verbose" mode so you can exactly see what is causing the slow OS boot.

1. Turn off mac.
2. Turn on mac and hold "CMD + V"
3. Boot Command Line should appear

title: Fan stopps spinning when I'm trying to measure voltage.
message:
"The big Samsung Chip close to the connector of the SSD gets very hot"
Do you mean the thunderbolt chip U2800?

title: Fan stopps spinning when I'm trying to measure voltage.
message:
[QUOTE="HeyWatchOutDude, post: 82629, member: 32502"]
Turn on "verbose" mode so you can exactly see what is causing the slow OS boot.

1. Turn off mac.
2. Turn on mac and hold "CMD + V"
3. Boot Command Line should appear
[/QUOTE]
Thank you, I will try this. It also runs slow after the OS booted up.


[QUOTE="2informaticos, post: 82637, member: 682"]
"The big Samsung Chip close to the connector of the SSD gets very hot"
Do you mean the thunderbolt chip U2800?
[/QUOTE]

No, sorry that was misunderstandable. I mean the Big Samsung chip that is soldered on the original Samsung SSD. The same chip gets hot on a 100% known good SSD. While the same SSD does not get hot in a working macbook.

I have measured voltages on the pins of the SSD connector. I have only a working 2015 13" MBP for comparison. Most voltages are not identical but similar. The only big difference that I have measured is:
on the working board I have 0V on pin 50 and 3.35V on pin 52,
while on the faulty board I have 3,27V on pin 50 and 0V on pin 52.

On some pins that have only mV values there are more differences.

title: Fan stopps spinning when I'm trying to measure voltage.
message:
Is important to get correct signals on U3740 and its related pins on SSD connector.

What is the fault history for this board, any liquid sign?

title: Fan stopps spinning when I'm trying to measure voltage.
message:
The board had traces of water damage at C8357. I have replaced it and have rebuilt contact to both sides of the board. Pad 2 of C8357 (which goes to the display connector on the other side) was gone. But now I have continuity where it is supposed to be.
Besides that, there were no other traces of water damage.

The values at U3740 without SSD are these:

1 - 3.41V
2 - 1.004V
3 - 3.29V
4 - 3.41V
5 - 0V
6 - 3.25V
7 - 3.30V
8 - 3.29V

With the SSD plugged in, these two values are different:

7 - 2.9mV
8 - 0.2 mV


PP3V3_S0SW_SSD is 3.35V

P3V3SSD_VMON is 1.004V

title: Fan stopps spinning when I'm trying to measure voltage.
message:
Voltages look good; with SSD inserted, of course.
Did you get these readings when the SSD is not recognized?

title: Fan stopps spinning when I'm trying to measure voltage.
message: I had these readings when the SSD was hot. I could connect a display to check if it gets recognized or not and repeat the readings. But I think the temperature already indicates that something is very wrong. It gets not only warm, it gets really burning hot.

title: Fan stopps spinning when I'm trying to measure voltage.
message: Does this SSD work good in other machine?

title: Fan stopps spinning when I'm trying to measure voltage.
message: Yes. I am using it right now. And I have tested with another known good SSD which also gets burning hot on that particular board.

title: Fan stopps spinning when I'm trying to measure voltage.
message:
Check SSD connector, may have corrosion; replace if needed.

Change U3710/11, just in case.

title: Fan stopps spinning when I'm trying to measure voltage.
message: Okay, I will try. I've just made these two pictures with a thermal cam. It is the same SSD in both pictures. One in a working 13" 2015 MBP, the other one on that faulty 13" 2013 board.

title: Fan stopps spinning when I'm trying to measure voltage.
message: I have replaced U3710 and U3711. Unfotunately no improvement. The SSD connector looks good to me:

title: Fan stopps spinning when I'm trying to measure voltage.
message:
There could be crap under SSD connector; not directly visible.
First, change L3700 and test...

title: Fan stopps spinning when I'm trying to measure voltage.
message: I have replaced L3700 and the SSD connector. Still no improvement. 😭😭😭
